entry.title: Mick Moloney (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mick Moloney (pictured) was a social worker in London before establishing the Green Fields of America, an Irish traditional music ensemble?

entry.title: Alien (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the working title of Alien was Star Beast?

entry.title: Linus Roth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Linus Roth, who plays the 1703 Dancla Stradivarius violin, recorded all compositions by Mieczysław Weinberg which feature a solo violin?

entry.title: arrest of Randal Worcester (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a bystander's video of the arrest of Randal Worcester in Mulberry, Arkansas, showed one law enforcement officer holding Worcester on the ground while two other officers beat him?

entry.title: Swiss Youth Symphony Orchestra (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Swiss Youth Symphony Orchestra was founded in 1969 for members from all four Swiss language regions, and meets twice a year for rehearsals and a tour program?

entry.title: Serious Sam: Tormental (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the video game Serious Sam: Tormental was originally inspired by Geometry Wars?

entry.title: Lion of Zion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Robert Redford helped the Lion of Zion receive a federal grant?
